text:
Source: We clean the dirty ditch, sweep rubbish then we bury rubbish.
Target: We clean the dirty ditches, sweep rubbish up, then we bury rubbish.

Explanation:
The word 'ditch' is replaced by 'ditches' to reflect the plural form, indicating that there may be more than one ditch being cleaned.
Error type: noun number
The word 'up' is inserted after 'rubbish' to form a phrasal verb 'sweep up', which means to clean or clear away the rubbish.
Error type: collocation
A comma is inserted after 'up' because commas are used to separate different segments of a compound sentence for clarity.
Error type: punctuation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Michael and Kate was so happy, until one day that Michael said to him dream to be a super hero, Kate get so nervous saying that it was ridiculous and just a kid dream and that Michael was only dreaming but that would never happen and that super hero don't exist.
Target: Michael and Kate were so happy, until one day Michael told her about of being a super hero. Kate got so agitated, that it was ridiculous and just a kid's dream and that Michael was only dreaming and that would never happen and that super heroes didn't exist.

Explanation:
The word 'was' is replaced by 'were' because when the subject is compound (Michael and Kate), the verb needs to be in the plural form.
Error type: person and number
The word 'that' is deleted because it is not needed here as 'one day' does not need to be followed by 'that'.
Error type: unnecessary word
The phrase 'said to' is replaced with 'told her about of' because the verb 'tell' is used when communicating information or facts to someone, and it's more accurate to use 'her' (Kate) instead of 'him'.
Error type: word choice
A period is inserted before 'Kate' to separate two independent clauses and to enhance readability.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'get' is replaced with 'got' to match the past tense used throughout the narration.
Error type: tense
The word 'nervous' is replaced with 'agitated' because the context indicates that Kate's response was more than just nervousness; she was upset or agitated.
Error type: word choice
The word 'saying' is deleted because it repeats the action of 'told' and is not necessary in this structure.
Error type: word redundancy
An "'s" is inserted after 'kid' to show possession - that the dream belongs to a kid.
Error type: possessive form
The word 'but' is replaced with 'and' to maintain the parallel structure and coherence in the chain of thoughts expressed by Kate.
Error type: conjunction
The word 'hero' is replaced with 'heroes' because 'super heroes' is the plural form which is needed to convey the general idea rather than a single 'super hero'.
Error type: plural form
The contraction 'don't' is replaced with 'didn't' to match the past tense used throughout the story.
Error type: tense

label.text: it is not needed here as 'one day' does not need to be followed by 'that'
A period is inserted before 'Kate'

text:
Source: Also watch videos of some best player like Sachin, Rahul, Sir Don breadman, Hayden, Wasim Akaram, Brett Lee etc.
Target: Also, watch videos of some of the best players, like Sachin, Rahul, Sir Don breadman, Hayden, Wasim Akaram, Brett Lee, etc.

Explanation:
A comma is inserted after "Also" to separate the introductory word from the rest of the sentence.
Error type: punctuation
The phrase 'of the' is inserted before 'best players' to indicate that we're talking about a specific group of people who are the best players.
Error type: determiner
The term 'player' is replaced by 'players' because 'some' is used to refer to an unspecified amount or number of people or things, so the noun it modifies should be plural.
Error type: noun number
A comma is inserted before 'etc.' to separate items in the list and conform with the serial comma rule, which states that a comma should be placed before conjunctions and disjunctions in a list.
Error type: punctuation

Source: Recently I saw the thriller of mokingjay part 2.
Target: Recently I saw the thriller of Mokingjay part 2.

Explanation:
The word 'mokingjay' is replaced by 'Mokingjay' because it is a proper noun (a title of a book or a film) and should be capitalized in English.
Error type: capitalization
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: I am sure that I will look after children very well.
Target: I am sure that I will look after the children very well.

Explanation:
The word 'the' is inserted before 'children' because 'the' is used to refer to specific children that the speaker and the listener know about. Without 'the', the sentence suggests the speaker will look after any children which may not be the intended meaning.
Error type: determiner
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: I Planned many interesting activities for views to make competition alive.
Target: I planned many interesting activities for views to make competitions come alive.

Explanation:
The word 'Planned' is replaced by 'planned' because in the middle of a sentence, the words should start with a lowercase letter unless it's a proper noun or at the start of a direct quote.
Error type: capitalization
The word 'competition' is replaced by 'competitions' because the noun 'competitions' in plural form indicates multiple instances of competition, which is more appropriate in the context of planning many activities.
Error type: number
The word 'come' is inserted before 'alive' because 'come alive' is an idiomatic expression that means 'become exciting or full of activity', which fits in the context.
Error type: missing word
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Technology, is something that is very important, something without which we can not live.
Target: Technology is something that is very important, something without which we can not live.

Explanation:
The first comma after 'Technology' is deleted because there is no need for a comma after the subject of a sentence.
Error type: punctuation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: When I was a child, I had a lot friends and they were very important for me.
Target: When I was a child, I had a lot friends and they were very important to me.

Explanation:
The word 'for' is replaced by 'to' because the adjective 'important' typically co-occurs with the preposition 'to', not 'for', when it comes to showing relevance or significance to someone. So we say 'important to me' not 'important for me'.
Error type: preposition usage
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: One of them I'm keen on playing basketball the best. I always spend more time on playing it.
Target: I'm keen on playing basketball the most. I always spend more time on playing it.

Explanation:
The phrase 'One of them' is deleted because it doesn't contribute to the meaning of the sentence and interrupts the clarity, making it confusing.
Error type: redundancy
The word 'best' is replaced by 'most' because when talking about preference for a single item or activity, 'most' is typically used rather than 'best'. 'Best' implies a comparison with other items or activities, which is not clearly indicated in the sentence.
Error type: word choice

label.text: talking about preference for a single item or activity, 'most' is typically used rather than 'best'. 'Best' implies a comparison with other items or activities, which is not clearly indicated in the sentence.

comments: "the most" is used to talk about quantity and "the best" is usually used to talk about quality.

text:
Source: Let me watch your house.
Target: Let me see your house.

Explanation:
The word 'watch' is replaced by 'see' because 'watch' implies observing something over a period of time, often for protective purposes, while 'see' suggests a brief or one-time observation, which is more suitable in this context when someone requests to view another's house.
Error type: word choice
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: If she wasn't awake, why she couldn't remember anything after that?
Target: If she wasn't awake, why couldn't she remembert anything after that?

Explanation:
The word 'couldn't' is relocated from after 'she' to before 'she' because in English, the word order of a direct question should be verb-subject. In this case, the auxiliary verb 'couldn't' should come before the subject 'she'.
Error type: word order
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: He doesn't have much time to prove their plan and he could not wait to let it happen.
Target: He didn't have much time to prove their plan and he could not wait to make it happen.

Explanation:
The word 'does' is replaced by 'did' because the sentence is referring to a past event, therefore the verb should be in the past form.
Error type: tense

The word 'let' is replaced by 'make' because the phrase 'make it happen' is more appropriate, it implies that he is taking action to ensure the event occurs, while 'let it happen' implies that the event is happening on its own and he is merely allowing it.
Error type: word choice
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Then they can sell them and get income of it.
Target: Then they can sell them and get income from it.

Explanation:
The preposition 'of' is replaced with 'from' because 'income from' is the correct collocation when referring to the earnings obtained from a particular source or activity.
Error type: collocation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: I like NewZealand because there are many islands.
Target: I like New Zealand because there are many islands.

Explanation:
The word 'NewZealand' is replaced by 'New Zealand' because the correct spelling of the country's name includes a space between 'New' and 'Zealand'.
Error type: spelling
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Just your wage paid too much lower than I expected, I want a little higher wages, payment of 300 yuan more than the existing wage basis.
Target: It's just that your wage paid is much lower than I expected. I want a little higher wages, payment of 300 yuan more than the existing wage basis.

Explanation:
The word 'Just' is replaced with "It's just" to introduce a fact or argument in a more emphatic way.
Error type: word choice
A comma is replaced with a period to properly end the first sentence before starting a new one, enhancing clarity and readability.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'too' is replaced with 'is' to construct a more grammatically accurate sentence. 'Is' correctly links the subject 'your wage' with the complement 'much lower than I expected'.
Error type: verb form
The word 'It' and 's' are inserted at the beginning of the sentence to form a correct contraction 'It's' for 'It is', to indicate that what follows is an explanation.
Error type: contraction
The word 'that' is inserted to introduce the clause that is the object of the verb 'is' in this sentence, helping enhance its clarity.
Error type: clause introduction

label.text: The word 'Just' is replaced with "It's just" to introduce a fact or argument in a more emphatic way.

comments: the same error is explained twice and the second one is correct. Hence, I marked the first one as incorrect.

text:
Source: The Computing Technology has been advancing very much this last years, making the old computers almost useless, getting better and making the difference between old and new computers grow even more with every new discoverement.
Target: Computing Technology has been advancing a great deal in recent years, making the old computers almost useless, getting better, and making the difference between old and new computers grow even more with every new invention.

Explanation:
The word 'The' is deleted because it is unnecessary to use 'The' before the broad general term 'Computing Technology', unless it's referring to a specific technology or a known entity.
Error type: unnecessary word
The phrase 'very much' is replaced by 'a great deal' as it's a more preferred way of expressing a significant amount or degree in formal English when referring to a technological advancement.
Error type: collocation
The phrase 'this last years' is replaced with 'in recent years'. 'In recent years' is a more accurate way to refer to the period of the last few years. Also, "this last years" is grammatically incorrect because "this" is singular while "years" is plural.
Error type: word choice
A comma is inserted before 'and' to indicate a list of actions that are happening due to Computed Technology advancement. In English, it's common to use commas to separate items in a list of three or more.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'discoverement' is replaced by 'invention' because 'discoverement' is not a standard English word, and the correct word to use in this context is 'invention', which refers to a useful new device or process.
Error type: spelling and word choice
edits:
['delete', 'The', '']
['replace', 'very much', 'a great deal']
['replace', 'this last years', 'in recent years']
['insert', '', ',']
['replace', 'discoverement', 'invention']
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Ten or eleven years at school make them tired, in spite of pupils don't notice it.
Target: Ten or eleven years at school makes them tired, although pupils don't notice it.

Explanation:
The word 'make' is replaced by 'makes' because the subject 'ten or eleven years at school' is considered a singular period of time, thus the verb should be in the singular form 'makes'.
Error type: subject-verb agreement
The phrase 'in spite of' is replaced by 'although'. 'In spite of' is usually used before a noun/noun phrase or the -ing form of a verb. When introducing a clause, we should use 'although' instead of 'in spite of'.
Error type: conjunction
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: They just have to calm talk about it.
Target: They just have to calmly talk about it.

Explanation:
The word 'calm' is replaced by 'calmly' because an adverb, rather than an adjective, is needed to modify the verb 'talk'. 'Calm' is an adjective, while 'calmly' is the adverb form.
Error type: word form
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: I took the sun a very long time and then I go to a cafe and and I drank a refreshment.
Target: I sunbathed for a very long time and then I went to a cafe and I drank a drink.

Explanation:
The phrase 'took the sun' is replaced by 'sunbathed' because 'sunbathed' is the correct verb for the action of lying in the sun.
Error type: word choice
The word 'for' is inserted after 'sunbathed' and before 'a very long time' to correctly express the duration of an activity.
Error type: preposition
The word 'go' is replaced by 'went' to match the past tense context established by 'sunbathed'.
Error type: verb tense
The word 'refreshment' is replaced by 'drink' as it is more common to refer to what one consumes in a cafe as a 'drink'.
Error type: word choice
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: On the other hand, I had taken care of my brothers and cousins for many hours when they were very young.
Target: On the other hand, I took care of my brothers and cousins for many hours when they were very young.

Explanation:
The phrase 'had taken' was replaced by 'took' because the past perfect (had taken) is usually used when there are two past events and one happened before the other. Here, there's no such context and the past simple (took) is more appropriate to indicate an action completed in the past.
Error type: tense
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: It's not just a hobby, it's more than this.
Target: It's not just a hobby; it's more than that.

Explanation:
The comma is replaced with a semicolon because both parts of the sentence are closely related independent clauses, and a semicolon is used to connect related thoughts in a clearer and more professional way.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'this' is replaced by 'that' because 'that' is used to refer to something previously mentioned or easily identified, while 'this' is used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced.
Error type: word choice
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Firstly, I would like to know how long the course lasts, and if it is possible the date exactly, because I need to book my flights.
Target: Firstly, I would like to know how long the course lasts, and if possible, the exact date because I need to book my flights.

Explanation:
The phrase 'it is' is deleted because it is not necessary in the context. After removing 'it is', the sentence still makes sense and is more concise.
Error type: unnecessary words
A comma is inserted after 'if possible' to separate the phrases and make the sentence more readable.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'exact' is inserted before 'date' to define the specificity of the date. The original phrase 'the date exactly' should be replaced with 'the exact date' to conform to usual English language construction.
Error type: word order
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: For this way, many people don't like to use the public transport because they want to move themselves when they need.
Target: For this reason, many people don't like to use public transport because they want to travel when they need to.

Explanation:
The word 'way' is replaced by 'reason'. 'For this way' is not a correct English phrase, the correct phrase is 'for this reason' which is used to show the cause of something.
Error type: word choice
The word 'the' is deleted because 'public transport' is a general term and does not require a determiner such as 'the'.
Error type: determiner
The phrase 'move themselves' is replaced by 'travel'. In English, 'move themselves' is not commonly used to mean 'travel'. Instead, 'travel' is a more commonly used and understood term.
Error type: word choice
The word 'to' is inserted after 'need' because 'need to' is the correct phrase and 'to' is used to indicate an intended action.
Error type: missing word
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Because of we are Chinese, why do we give up our mother tongue and learn our owne culture through a foreign language?
Target: Because if we are Chinese, why do we give up our mother tongue and learn about our own culture through a foreign language?

Explanation:
The word 'of' is replaced with 'if' because 'if' is required before 'we are Chinese' to express the condition or hypothetical situation in the sentence.
Error type: preposition
The word 'about' is inserted in the sentence after 'learn' to suggest that we are gaining or seeking knowledge of our own culture, which is the correct usage in this context.
Error type: missing word
The word 'owne' is replaced with 'own' because 'own' is the correct spelling which shows possession over something, in this case, culture.
Error type: spelling
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Do you know that 75% of people in Mexico, doesn't practice any type of exercise, this is a big problem to our society and is the problem number 1 of why Mexico is the country with more obese in the world.
Target: Do you know that 75% of people in Mexico don't do any type of exercise? This a big problem for our society and is the number 1 problem of why Mexico is the country with the most obese people in the world.

Explanation:
The word 'doesn't' is replaced by 'don't' because the subject '75% of people' is plural, which requires the use of 'do not' or 'don't'.
Error type: agreement
The word 'practice' is replaced by 'do' as 'do exercise' is the more commonly accepted phrase, although it is valid to say 'practice exercise', the former is used more widely.
Error type: collocation
The word 'to' is replaced by 'for' because 'problem for' is the correct collocation in English when referring to a problem affecting a particular group.
Error type: preposition usage
The extra 'problem' is deleted as it was repeated unnecessarily.
Error type: redundancy
The expression 'of why' is replaced by 'the number 1 problem of why' for clarity and emphasis on the severity of the problem.
Error type: clarity and emphasis
The phrase 'more obese' is replaced by 'the most obese people' because 'the most' is used to denote the highest degree among more than two entities.
Error type: comparative and superlative form
edits:
['replace', "doesn't", "don't"]
['replace', 'practice', 'do']
['replace', 'to', 'for']
['delete', 'problem', '']
['replace', 'of why', 'the number 1 problem of why']
['replace', 'more obese', 'the most obese people']

label.text: The expression 'of why' is replaced by 'the number 1 problem of why' for clarity and emphasis on the severity of the problem.
people
The extra 'problem' is deleted as it was repeated unnecessarily.

text:
Source: We found a pharmacy and a restroom where we could get a rest and take a shower to clean ourselves.
Target: We found a pharmacy and a restroom where we could have a rest and take a shower to clean ourselves.

Explanation:
The verb 'get' is replaced by 'have' because the correct collocation for a rest is 'have a rest'. The verb 'have' is often used to describe situations, experiences, or states, such as taking a rest.
Error type: collocation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: In conclusion, my opinion is I do not like to do any sports but we need to choose one kind of sport in our life and almost all people need to do it, as we could not stay at home or working all the time.
Target: In conclusion, I do not like to do any sports, but we need to choose one kind of sport in our life and almost all people need to do it, as we should not stay at home or work all the time.

Explanation:
The phrase 'my opinion is' is deleted because it's redundant. When you say 'In conclusion,' the following statement is automatically understood to be your opinion.
Error type: redundancy
A comma is inserted after 'sports' to separate two independent clauses in the same sentence.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'could' is replaced by 'should' to change the meaning from possibility to advice or recommendation.
Error type: word choice
The word 'working' is replaced by 'work' because the conjunction 'or' is followed by a base verb, which should be parallel with the base verb 'stay' in the previous clause.
Error type: word form
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Should learn other languages?.
Target: Should we learn other languages?

Explanation:
The word 'we' is inserted because a subject is needed in the sentence to make it grammatically correct. Without it, it is unclear who the question is referring to.
Error type: missing word
The dot at the very end is deleted because it is unharmful when it follows a period, and a sentence doesn't require two sentence-ending punctuation marks.
Error type: punctuation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: The terrible consequences, are caused by the humans' unsatisfied heart.
Target: These terrible consequences are caused by the humans' unsatisfied hearts.

Explanation:
The word 'The' is replaced by 'These' because 'these' refers to specific consequences that are close to the speaker (physically or figuratively as in context) while 'the' is used for specific consequences previously mentioned or understood in the context.
Error type: determiner
The comma is deleted after 'consequences' because it's unnecessary. A comma should not separate the subject and the predicate in a sentence.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'heart' is replaced by 'hearts' because 'hearts' is the plural form coordinated with 'humans' which indicates multiple individuals' hearts.
Error type: word form
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: If the partially damaged sheets are bad, they will be treated as bad sheets, which will be securely distoryed.
Target: If the partially damaged sheets are bad, they will be treated as bad sheets, which will be securely destroyed.

Explanation:
The word 'distoryed' is replaced by 'destroyed' because 'distoryed' is not a word in English. 'Destroyed' is correctly used here to mean that the bad sheets will be completely ruined or eradicated.
Error type: spelling
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Yes it is true that during summer the temperature is very hot and you can rarely stay near the sun because you finish t be burn by the sun.
Target: Yes, it is true that during summer the temperature is very hot and you can rarely stay in the sun because you end being burnt by the sun.

Explanation:
A comma is inserted after 'Yes' to separate it from the rest of the sentence, as a pause is typically required after an interjection.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'near' is replaced by 'in' because 'in the sun' is the correct phrase to express exposure to sunlight.
Error type: preposition
The word 'finish' is replaced by 'end' because 'end up' is the appropriate phrase to indicate the final result of a process.
Error type: collocation
The letter 't' is replaced by 'being' to form the phrase 'end up being', which indicates a change to a new, usually unplanned, state.
Error type: word form
The word 'burn' is replaced by 'burnt' because the verb 'burn' should be in its past participle form 'burnt' after 'being'.
Error type: word form

label.text: because 'end up' is the appropriate phrase to indicate the final result of a process.\nError type: collocation
The letter 't' is replaced by 'being' to form the phrase 'end up being', which indicates a change to a new, usually unplanned, state.

text:
Source: Secondly, I do not like to go to beach, this is because I do not like big sun and sand.
Target: Secondly, I do not like to go to the beach. This because I do not like bright sunshine and sand.

The word 'the' is inserted before 'beach' because definite article 'the' is used before 'beach' to indicate the specific beach that one generally goes to or refers to.
Error type: determiner
The phrase ', this' is replaced by '. This' because a period is needed to separate these two independent clauses, and the beginning of the second clause should be capitalized.

The word 'beach' is mistakenly inserted but this change was not necessary as 'beach' was already in the correct place in the original sentence.

The phrase 'big sun' is replaced by 'bright sunshine' because 'bright sunshine' is a suitable expression to describe intense sunlight.

Source: First of all, you should get outside of the airport terminal.
Target: First of all, you should go out of the airport terminal.

The phrase 'get outside' is replaced by 'go out' because in this context, 'go out' is a more appropriate term to imply the physical act of leaving or exiting a building, in this case, the airport terminal.

text:
Source: SMS such as Facebook send out 700.000 messages, and 170.000 Tweets are publicized on Twitter each 60 seconds.
Target: SMS, such as Facebook, send out 700,000 messages, and 170,000 Tweets are published on Twitter every 60 seconds.

Explanation:
A comma is inserted before and after 'such as Facebook' to separate this non-essential information from the rest of the sentence. With the commas, it clarifies that Facebook is an example of an SMS service, but not the only one.
Error type: punctuation
The numbers '700.000' and '170.000' are replaced by '700,000' and '170,000' respectively because in English, commas are used as thousand separators while periods are used as decimal points.
Error type: number format
The word 'publicized' is replaced by 'published' because tweets are 'published' and not 'publicized'. 'Publicize' is more commonly used when something is made widely known or promoted while 'published' is used when something is issued for public distribution.
Error type: word choice
The word 'each' is replaced by 'every' because 'every' is commonly used with singular countable units of time to indicate frequency, while 'each' is usually used for individual items in a list or a group.
Error type: word choice
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: My job was checking songs list which singers would perform.
Target: My job was checking the song list which singers would perform.

Explanation:
The phrase 'songs list' is replaced with 'the song list' because 'the' is commonly used before a singular noun phrase and 'song list' makes more grammatical sense than 'songs list' in this context. The usage of 'song list' denotes that there is a list made up of various songs that the singers would perform.
Error type: word form and article usage
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: That's why it is important: it makes us understand to never give up and follow our dreams.
Target: That's why it is important: it makes us understand that we should never give up and to follow our dreams.

Explanation:
The word 'to' is replaced by 'that we should' because 'understand' in this context requires a clause after it to explain what is being understood, rather than an infinitive verb 'to never'.
Error type: word choice
The conjunction 'to' is inserted before 'follow' to indicate both actions 'never give up' and 'follow our dreams' as parallel actions or ideas, using 'and' to connect them.
Error type: conjunction
comments: The target sentence does not correctly correct the source sentence.

text:
Source: I had butterflies in my stomach.'Yes, I am fine,' Winnie replied.
Target: I had butterflies in my stomach. 'Yes, I am fine,' Winnie replied.

Explanation:
A space is inserted before the quotation mark of 'Yes, I am fine,' because according to punctuation rules there should be a space before a quotation mark if it is not the start of a sentence.
Error type: punctuation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: Mostly Facebook users expect their friend to respond or pay attention on what they are doing.
Target: Mostly, Facebook users expect their friends to respond or pay attention to what they are doing.

Explanation:
A comma is inserted after 'Mostly' because it is an adverb starting the sentence and should be followed by a comma to separate it from the rest of the sentence.
Error type: punctuation
The word 'friend' is replaced by 'friends' because the word 'friends' should be in plural form as it refers to all the people connected to a user on Facebook, not just one friend.
Error type: word form
The word 'on' is replaced with 'to', because the correct expression is 'pay attention to' used when telling someone to focus or direct their attention towards something.
Error type: preposition usage

text:

The term 'concluding' is replaced with 'conclusion,' because "In conclusion" is a more appropriate phrase to signal the end of the discourse. Also, a comma is added after 'conclusion' to separate it from the rest of the sentence.
Error type: word choice and punctuation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:

The term 'beef burgers' is replaced by 'beefburgers' because it is a concept that is commonly denoted by a single compound word in English. Writing it as two separate words may create confusion.

text:
Source: Though it has probably been around for awhile, it's presence hasn't really been known untill fairly recently, and it's consequences have been devistating.
Target: Though it has probably been around for a while its presence hasn't really been known until fairly recently, and its consequences have been devastating.

Explanation:
The word 'awhile' is replaced by 'a while' because 'awhile' is an adverb meaning 'for a short time', whereas 'a while' is a noun phrase used after the preposition 'for' to mean 'a period of time".
Error type: word choice
The word 'untill' is replaced by 'until' because 'until' is the correct spelling of the word indicating up to / before a certain point of time.
Error type: spelling
The word 'devistating' is replaced by 'devastating' because 'devastating' is the correct spelling of the word used to describe something highly destructive or damaging.
Error type: spelling

label.text: it's

text:

text:
Source: Granted, it is the person who 'told' the computer what to do that truly made the error; however if that person knew what he should do, or better stated 'was able to do with a computer', he would not have erroneous answers.
Target: Granted, it is the person who 'told' the computer what to do that truly made the error. However, person knew what he should do, or better stated 'was able to do with a computer', he would not have erroneous answers.

Explanation:
The semicolon is replaced by a period because a new independent clause is starting. While a semicolon can be used to join two closely related independent clauses, it is more conventional to use a period when the connection between clauses is already clear or additionally clarified by a connecting word like 'however'.
Error type: punctuation
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:

Target: A rather hard view would be that if someone who works on a menial or physically taxing job does not make a fair or moderate salary, then it is his or her own fault (or bad luck).

A comma is inserted before 'then' to separate the two independent clauses in the sentence. This helps the reading process and makes the meaning of the sentence clearer.
Error type: punctuation

text:
Source: It is unfair to hold responsible the scientist on the fore front of human knowledge, who discovers something when another scientist in another part of the world may make the discovery independently afterwards.
Target: It is unfair to hold responsible the scientist at the forefront of human knowledge, who discovers something when another scientist in another part of the world may make the discovery independently afterwards.

Explanation:
The preposition 'on' is replaced by 'at' because when we refer to a position or status, 'at' is usually used.
Error type: preposition
The two separate words 'fore front' are replaced by the single word 'forefront' because 'forefront' is a single word meaning the leading or most important position or place.
Error type: spelling
all_correct: There is no error in the explanation(s) above.

text:
Source: We must remember, however, that the field of technology is not the only one in which significant advances have been made in the 0th century.
Target: We must remember, however, that the field of technology is not the only one in which significant advances have been made in the 20th century.

The term '0th' is replaced by '20th' because '0th' is not a grammatically correct ordinal number in English. In this context, '20th' is used to indicate the correct historical century where significant technological advances were made.
Error type: numeral

text:

text:
Source: The idea I feel that has most significantly changed people's lives in the 20th century is that of caring for the environment.
Target: The idea that I feel has most significantly changed people's lives in the 20th century is that of caring for the environment.

Explanation:
The word 'that' is relocated from after 'I feel' to before 'I feel' because 'that' is a relative pronoun that introduces a relative clause. The clause 'that I feel has most significantly changed people's lives in the 20th century' provides information about the 'idea', so 'that' should directly follow 'idea'.
Error type: word order

text:
Source: Modern times saw gas and electric ranges as to staple.
Target: Modern times saw gas and electric ranges become a staple.

Explanation:
The phrase 'as to' is replaced with 'become' because 'become' is appropriate to show the transformation of gas and electric ranges into a staple. 'As to' is incorrect in this context because it can mean 'about' or 'regarding' which does not fit in this sentence.
Error type: word choice
The article 'a' is inserted before 'staple' to specify that gas and electric ranges have become one recognized part or item of importance (staple) in modern times. 'Staple' is a singular countable noun here so it needs an article.
